6 Stunning Plants and Flowers for Vibrant & Eco-Friendly Diwali Celebrations
Diwali is just around the corner! This year instead of decorating your house with artificial items, add some freshness, colour and warmth. These flowers and plants don't just look beautiful; they also bring fragrance and a sense of calm to your place. Go little green and add an eco-friendly touch to your decor. Here are 6 stunning plants and flowers you can choose from to add to the list of your festive decorations, which will surely bring positive vibes to the house during the celebrations.
Chrysanthemum (Guldaudi)
These are one of the popular Diwali decoration plants, come in vibrant colours and don't require much maintenance. These plants can be used as potted plants to brighten rooms or balconies, or their blooms can be cut for floral arrangements, bringing a beautiful, long-lasting display during the festivities.
Fiddle Leaf Fig
The fiddle-leaf fig is believed to be a symbol of abundance and good luck. These violin-shaped leaves are perfect for larger areas in your house, and you can even drape string lights around them to give them a festive glow.
Hibiscus
These plants boast exotic blooms in red, pink and yellow, and it is believed these plants are associated with Lord Ganesha, among other deities. The red hibiscus flowers are considered auspicious and symbolise devotion and purity.
Lilies
The fragrant lilies are the best choice to put out during your Diwali celebrations. Lilies come in a range of colours, including white, pink, yellow, and orange, allowing you to choose according to your preferences. Their blooms are popular for lasting for a long while and can be planted in pots.
Marigolds
No Diwali celebration is complete without the presence of marigolds. These vibrant flowers are used to make garlands; the petals of these are used to make rangolis and are even used in religious offerings. These plants are easy to grow and can be planted in gardens or pots or used as cut flowers in arrangements.
Orchids
Orchids are champions of all flowers, and they truly have the charm to make any space look sophisticated. You can use pink or blue orchids to create a perfect arrangement on trays or in metal baskets. These plants are relatively easy to care for and can thrive in both indoor and outdoor environments.
